clinical_study.brief_title: Drug Interactions With Risk of QT-prolongation in a General Hospital
clinical_study.official_title: Drug Interactions With Risk of QT-prolongation in a General Hospital: an Epidemiological Point Prevalence Study

collaborator.agency: Agentschap voor Innovatie door Wetenschap en Technologie

brief_summary.textblock: In this epidemiological point prevalence study, medication profiles of patients with haloperidol treatment will be checked for drug interactions with risk of QT-prolongation. Additional clinical risk factors for developing QT-prolongation and safety measurements will be documented.

detailed_description.textblock:
Study design: epidemiological point prevalence study
Target population: Patients with haloperidol treatment
The following aspects will be investigated:
- The medication profiles will be checked for drug interactions with risk of QT-prolongation.
- Clinical risk factors for developing QT-prolongation (gender, age, (history of) cardiovascular disease, comorbidity,...) and lab results will be collected.
- Safety measurements (e.g. ECG) will be documented.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.time_frame: maximum one year before inclusion / one week after inclusion

secondary_outcome.measure: number of drug interactions (with risk of QT-prolongation)

other_outcome.measure: number of patients with an ECG before or after the start of haloperidol
other_outcome.time_frame: maximum one year before inclusion / one week after inclusion

study_pop.textblock: patients who are treated with haloperidol (every tuesday we will make a selection of the patients who received haloperidol on monday)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- treatment with haloperidol (started in the hospital)
Exclusion Criteria:
- age < 18 years
